alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 22 at 2:36AM MST until December 25 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY THROUGH EARLY THIS WEEKEND... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow likely. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet possible late Thursday afternoon through Saturday morning. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...The Sierra Madre Range and the Snowy Range. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and drifting snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong gusty winds may result in significant blowing snow and also very cold wind chill temperatures below zero by Friday night.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
